intro: Ceodes umbellifera var. acuminata, commonly known as the narrow-leaved ceodes, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes many aromatic herbs and vegetables. The plant is characterized by its slender, compound leaves and small, white or greenish flowers arranged in umbels. It typically grows in wetlands and along the edges of streams, thriving in moist, sandy soils. The species is noted for its ecological value, providing habitat and nectar for various pollinators.
